top_comment.text:
Hi mindy, 
I have a really hard time getting my hair to hold curl. I have tried 
everything from using hairspray to mouse to hair wax but nothing works. My 
hair is stick straight, and I would like to add texture to it. Any tips?﻿
top_comment.author: LexiLove

comments.text:
My hair was the same with curls. I I researched and I found this product 
that works really well. Its called Tresemmé thermal creations curl 
activator spray and its only like $5. Spray it in your hair before you curl 
and wait 3 mins then curl. Good luck!
comments.author: Tara Jane

comments.text:
I have the same kind of hair and even if I do the curls pinned up and 
hairspray they still fall out
comments.author: Sier bear

comments.text:
Is your hair cut straight or in layers? Supposedly if cut in layers it is 
easier to curl
comments.author: lolazo2002

comments.text:
And once they're pinned spray them with hairspray and let it dry to set 
before releasing them
comments.author: Caitie Pearson

comments.text:
After you release it from the iron, pin the curl up and don't take out the 
pins until all the hair is cooled off.
comments.author: Eileen Yost

captions.text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

-(SINGING) Let's go back to
that little place where we.
-Hey everyone.

I'm Mindy from Cute
Girls Hairstyles.

-And I'm Brooklyn from
Brooklyn and Bailey.

-And today we're
going to show you

how to do a bubble
fishtail combo.

So this is kind of a
combination of our bubble
ponytail and our fishtail combo.

But it looks really,
really cute on
and I love the way it turns out.
So let's get started.

Now to begin on
this hair style, I

have left some hair down over
her ears for a little more

grown up look,
which she prefers.

But you can certainly
pull that hair

back too if you're
working with smaller kids.

I've pulled it back into
a basically a half up

look and secured
it with an elastic.

Now I'm going to go underneath
and take a piece of hair, just
a small little piece.

And I'm going to wrap
it around this elastic

twice because we want
this to be hair wrapped.

And then I'm going to have her
give me one of those bobby pins
I had her hold.

And I'll show you
what I'm going to do.

I'm going to take
the bobby pin and I'm

going to slip the hair
through it like this.

And then I'm going to
take it underneath.

And I'm going to stick it
downward and into the hair.

And then I'm going to just
add all that hair back
into what I'm doing next.

So we'll wrap and
cover up that elastic,

but the bobby pin
helps secure it.

Once I have hair
all wrapped, then

I'm going to take
the rest of this hair
and divide it in half.

And I'm going to go ahead
and begin a fishtail braid.

Now a fishtailing,
you basically are just

taking pieces from
the back and the side

and crossing them over
into the other section.

In the process they
cross each other,

which creates our
fishtailing pattern.

And I'm going to do
this for probably three
to four inches of hair.

You can do the pieces as small
or as large as you would like.

The smaller piece, the more
fishtail pattern it has.

The bigger the piece, the more
sort of looks like a braid.

So it's just your
personal preference.
Keep going.

When I get down
about this far, I'm

going to go ahead and secure
it again with an elastic.

So I'm just going to take a
hair elastic and secure this.

And then I am once again going
to reach around to the back

and try to find a
little bit longer piece

and wrap that around
that hair elastic.
Take a bobby pin-- thank you.

Turn you a little bit farther to
the other side so they can see.

Take the bobby pin,
put it over the hair.
Make sure you get all of it.

Reach around to the back and
then push the bobby pin down.

And that'll help secure
that hair in place
so you have a nice wrap.

Now I'm going to go back
and fluff my fishtail

a little bit right
here, loosen it.

And then you're going
to repeat what we just

did on this first
section again right here.
[MUSIC PLAYING]
And there you go.
So here's the final spin.
Do-do-do!
And I love this one.

Now if you guys haven't
seen, Brooklyn and Baily

have a giveaway running on
their channel right now.
I'll let you explain it.

-It's a back-to-school
supplies giveaway.

It's got some really
cool things in it.

Beat headphones, a
backpack-- the same backpacks

Bailey and I are using
this year for school.

So it's got some
really cool stuff.
If you want to check it out.
-Lots of school supplies.
-Yes.
So we're super excited.

-We will put the link
in the description box
below or in the corner up there.
You can find their video.

So go check it out, and we
will see you guys next Sunday.
Bye guys.
-Bye!
[MUSIC PLAYING]

-Now if you have
longer hair like mine,
you're going to double that bit.

And if you have shorter hair,
you can just do it once.

Now you're going
to take the pencil
and twist it, so at that point.
-[INAUDIBLE]
-Good job.
-I want to play tea party.
-Tea party?
-There's no tea party.
-[INAUDIBLE], tea party.
-Yes, there is.
In the house.
-No, that's just kitchen.
-[INAUDIBLE].
-Camera.
-I'm a do that.
-Hurry.

title: Bubble Fishtail Braid Combo | Hairstyles for Long Hair
